intro: Ranunculus gardenensis, commonly known as the garden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers with numerous petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The flowers bloom in spring and early summer, adding a vibrant touch to gardens and natural habitats.
